result.execSummary:
All charges against Sankofa Y Neal in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sankofa Y Neal is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sankofa Y Neal

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sankofa Y Neal not in court.  Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court for Sankofa Y Neal.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
Matter set for status conference.  Parties informed the Court the defendant is deceased.  On motion of the state, Court ordered case dismissed.

Attorney Douglas J. Rebholz in court.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not appear. Hearing held via zoom. Attorney Rebholz states that defendant may have passed away, but needs additional time to get confirmation. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Sankofa Y Neal in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Hearing held via Zoom.  Pretrial conference held.  Atty. Rebholz has received discovery and an offer and would like additional time to review with his client.  Case adjourned to Br. 1.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 6-27-2022, FILED.  RMM

Court ordered no contact with Katie J. M.;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3. The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Court orders defendant to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sankofa Y Neal in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Sankofa Y Neal in custody.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sankofa Y Neal appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 1. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION. This hearing may be streamed live at the Court's discretion on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/83289ee0-2326-3076-b9a3-4c551cf64527  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
